capabilities.name: mobile_list_available_devices
capabilities.description: List all available devices. This includes both physical devices and simulators. If there is more than one device returned, you need to let the user select one of them.

capabilities.name: mobile_use_device
capabilities.description: Select a device to use. This can be a simulator or an Android device. Use the list_available_devices tool to get a list of available devices.

capabilities.name: mobile_list_apps
capabilities.description: List all the installed apps on the device

capabilities.name: mobile_launch_app
capabilities.description: Launch an app on mobile device. Use this to open a specific app. You can find the package name of the app by calling list_apps_on_device.

capabilities.name: mobile_terminate_app
capabilities.description: Stop and terminate an app on mobile device

capabilities.name: mobile_get_screen_size
capabilities.description: Get the screen size of the mobile device in pixels

capabilities.name: mobile_click_on_screen_at_coordinates
capabilities.description: Click on the screen at given x,y coordinates

capabilities.name: mobile_list_elements_on_screen
capabilities.description: List elements on screen and their coordinates, with display text or accessibility label. Do not cache this result.

capabilities.name: mobile_open_url
capabilities.description: Open a URL in browser on device

capabilities.name: mobile_type_keys
capabilities.description: Type text into the focused element

capabilities.name: mobile_take_screenshot
capabilities.description: Take a screenshot of the mobile device. Use this to understand what's on screen, if you need to press an element that is available through view hierarchy then you must list elements on screen instead. Do not cache this result.

capabilities.name: mobile_set_orientation
capabilities.description: Change the screen orientation of the device

capabilities.name: mobile_get_orientation
capabilities.description: Get the current screen orientation of the device
